issue.title: Question about loading of labels.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Thank you for your great project. I have some question about labeling system.
Cause there is no possibility to separate work between two or more people without overlapping, i created several amount of project and now i have to i`m trying to create labels for all these project. Is there any possibility to load same set of labels for all of these project? Also will be great if there is possibility to make them share the same colors in all projects. If there is a quick way to make it with django admin it will be also fine.

issue.title: Show only documents without annotations when sharing labels across users

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### Problem
When doing document classification with shared labels across users, the button which should show only the "Active" documents to be annotated, actually shows documents already annotated by other users.
That is a bit annoying as there is no direct way to jump to the still unlabelled documents.

### Additional info
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6605510/63764249-5102f300-c8be-11e9-8ce2-d38d67e6f1c4.png)

### System information
- Ubuntu 18.04
- Python 3.6

issue.title: Splitting the data-set

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### System information
- Linux Ubuntu 18.04
- Python Version: 3.6

### Splitting the data-set between multiple annotators
We have a large data-set that needs to be annotated by a few people. Is it currently possible to filter out the documents that were annotated by someone else from a users annotations list? 
The objective is to save time by having each document annotated only once.

Currently we ended up splitting the data-set into several projects and assigning each project to a different person.

Thanks!

issue.title: Separate labels from projects

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi. I faced a problem connected with labeling. Imagine you have a big dataset which you want to split into smaller pieces and give it to markup for different people. To do this you always have to make a new project and implement labels (which would be the same as in other projects). If you have a lot of splitted texts it becomes quite tiringly.
So I guess it would be more effective if we could create labels separately and just choosing appropriate label set from projects.

Also, I think same situation could be with texts. So maybe someone could need to markup the same texts with different labels set. In that case more efficient would be to make projects as connections between texts and label sets.

issue.body: I found I made an error in the data formatting and need to empty a project of data and start again, but i seem to only be able to delete one by one? Ideally I could copy the labels to a new set and start again but I know that is raised in #360  already

body: #356 is very necessary when updating docker images. Took me 2 hours to restore shortcuts for each label in the new container. Would be good to have a configuration file.
